articles.author: Nandita Bose, Jarrett Renshaw, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris wasted no time launching her 2024 presidential campaign, seeking the support of fellow Democrats with the backing of President Joe Biden after he pulled out of the race amid concerns about his age and health.
articles.title: Backed by Biden, Harris moves to lock up White House bid

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli tank shelling and airstrikes killed at least 16 Palestinians near Khan Younis, Gaza medics said on Monday, after Israel issued new orders to evacuate some neighbourhoods following what it said were renewed attacks from those areas.
articles.title: Israel issues evacuation orders in south Gaza, kills 16 Palestinians

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander said on Monday that Russian forces were staging relentless assaults to try to advance towards the town of Pokrovsk, a logistics hub in the east, and that there was active fighting taking place along the entire front line.
articles.title: Russian troops mount pressure on Ukrainian logistics hub of Pokrovsk

articles.author: Sam Jahan, Mohammad Ponir Hossain
articles.description: Bangladesh appeared calm on Monday amid a curfew, but widespread disruption of telecoms prevailed a day after the Supreme Court scrapped some quotas for government jobs that sparked protests this month that killed scores.
articles.title: Bangladesh calm a day after top court scrapped some job quotas

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel declared dead on Monday two more of its hostages being held in Gaza, as talks to secure a ceasefire deal that would include the release of some 120 captives there were set to resume later this week.
articles.title: Israel declares two more Gaza hostages dead

articles.author: Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan started its annual Han Kuang war games on Monday, which this year aim to be as close as possible to actual combat with no script and simulating how to repel a Chinese attack.
articles.title: Taiwan starts annual war games, aiming to closely mimic actual combat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union has decided to open dialogue on visa liberalisation with Armenia, the EU said on Monday, in what Yerevan's foreign minister described as a "milestone" for the traditional Russian ally's ties with the bloc.
articles.title: EU says it will start talks with Armenia on visa-free travel

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits Washington this week, under pressure to end the Gaza war both from Israelis who want hostages brought home and from a U.S. administration focusing increasingly on the presidential election.
articles.title: Israel's Netanyahu heading to Washington with US in flux over election race

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish Primer Minister Pedro Sanchez was summoned to testify as a witness in an investigation about alleged corruption and influence peddling accusations against his wife that led him to consider resigning in April, the court said on Monday.
articles.title: Spain's PM to testify as witness in wife's alleged corruption case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top diplomat will visit China on Tuesday at the invitation of Beijing for talks that Kyiv said would focus on how to end Russia's war in Ukraine and on a possible Chinese role in reaching a settlement.
articles.title: Ukraine's top diplomat to visit China this week to talk peace, Kyiv says
